Keywords: Assassin , Masters of Evil , Ruler , Soldier
Real Name: Helmut Zemo
Special Powers
I HAVE THE WILL TO COMPLETE THIS MISSION: Outwit, Perplex. When Baron Zemo uses either to target an opposing character, after resolutions, roll a d6. 5-6: Deal 1 penetrating damage to an opposing character that is adjacent to the targeted character.

Comments
June 13, 2022
Oathful
I want to love this piece, but I just can't help but compare him to #062 Baron Zemo from CAAV. For 5 points more you just get so much more than this one offers. If you're willing to waive the keyword cheating, leadership and the ability to gain a team ability for succeeding your leadership roll for a perplex and some penetrating damage, go ahead. Very thematic for his Civil War appearance though, I do like that. Thematic: 8/10 Viability: 5.5/10 Fun Factor: 6/10, leans towards casual
May 31, 2022
Bobcat2022
That sure is a Baron Zemo dial, yep. Masters of Evil TA seems wasted on this one, considering how much he wants to be exactly six squares out from the action, no less (and no more, unless he's got support with the SHIELD TA). In Sealed, he's gonna be spectacular 1 game out of 3, assuming your opponent sees his SP and places their figures adjacent to one another anyway. In Constructed, I'd pair him up with the Common and claim that one's his butler in disguise. Also, I don't want to begrudge both D+ versions of Captain Sokovia getting the MoE keyword when that organization is yet to be revealed as existing in the MCU and Zemo has a bevy of excellent 616 figures in other sets (including the one immediately previous) but it does make one wonder why Tommy Maximoff couldn't get the Young Avengers keyword for his second clixed appearance in the entire history of the game. Just saying.
May 3, 2022
Goop
You know i actually like him quite a bit, you got outwit+perplex and potential to do free damage. Your opponent has to deal with him and he has mastermind + stealth which makes him harder to get rid of. Maybe a bit of over costed considering his low damage but still not a bad piece.
April 22, 2022
burleigh2
Yes, if you get the rolls, he could deal 2 instances of 1 damage to a figure adjacent to the target (assuming he target the same one in that example)

So if I’m reading his special correctly you get to potentially deal 2 penetrating damage per turn. Yes it’s die dependent but so is most of this game lol.
